guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

author.bio: GM of +Clownworld +News +Commentary +Conspiracy +Christianity +Prolife +Conservatives +MAGA and a few others
author.bio_html: GM of +ClownWorld +News +Commentary +Conspiracy +Christianity +ProLife +Conservatives +MAGA and a few others

body:
Non-denominational or "protestant". I have attended many kinds of churches growing up, but I find the most joy, authenticity, and vulnerability in smaller bible following churches that aren't necessarily connected to any larger "church authority" but were built from different individuals passionate about God not cold religious tradition. I look for churches that worship sincerely and vibrantly, where it seems like the Holy Spirit's presence is alive and touching people there. Places where I can have warm real people conversations. That will seem biased. I don't find connection in churches that quietly stand and sit while being read to. For other Christians if that's their thing that's fine... I honor all my brothers and sisters in Christ who sincerely follow the Lord. 

As Guildmaster I have never made a point to make any "brand" of Christianity pushed or endorsed here. I comment from my perspective. Mostly importantly are the key things of the faith and your personal relationship with God. It's God who sees our hearts and judges our conduct, we firstly answer to Him, not the teachings of any particular pastor or "church authority." All are always welcome, even with different ideas on the finer points of theology. The Church is all of us.

I look for churches that worship sincerely and vibrantly, where it seems like the Holy Spirit's presence is alive and touching people there. Places where I can have warm real people conversations. That will seem biased. I don't find connection in churches that quietly stand and sit while being read to. For other Christians if that's their thing that's fine... I honor all my brothers and sisters in Christ who sincerely follow the Lord.

As Guildmaster I have never made a point to make any "brand" of Christianity pushed or endorsed here. I comment from my perspective. Mostly importantly are the key things of the faith and your personal relationship with God. It's God who sees our hearts and judges our conduct, we firstly answer to Him, not the teachings of any particular pastor or "church authority." All are always welcome, even with different ideas on the finer points of theology. The Church is all of us.

body: None, because otherwise I'd be dealing with the Pharisees. "Church" is a false translation of the word "assembly" which usually referred to the body of believers. They had underground gatherings which were nothing like the churches we have today, and disagreements were tolerated and not cause for division into different denominations. That alone exposes the failure of religious establishment, which was initially set up to control people and benefit the elites. This still happens today on a smaller scale with denominations, because they mostly retain the catholic church hierarchy: sit down, shut up, obey the pastor, don't speak out or question, and give us your money. Many of them have higher governing bodies as well, similar to the papacy. It doesn't work and only results in division over the silliest disagreements.
body_html: None, because otherwise I'd be dealing with the Pharisees. "Church" is a false translation of the word "assembly" which usually referred to the body of believers. They had underground gatherings which were nothing like the churches we have today, and disagreements were tolerated and not cause for division into different denominations. This still happens today on a smaller scale with denominations, because they mostly retain the catholic church hierarchy: sit down, shut up, obey the pastor, don't speak out or question, and give us your money. body: Christianity isn't a "biblical" religion, there isn't one canon, and there isn't one consistent narrative in any one canon. And who compiled and canonized your Bible, and according to which self-professed authority?
body_html: Christianity isn't a "biblical" religion, there isn't one canon, and there isn't one consistent narrative in any one canon. And who compiled and canonized your Bible, and according to which self-professed authority?

He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.
guild.description_html:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God.

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.
guild.name: Christianity

parent.body:
I’ve just decided you’re one of the people not worth arguing with. 

Have a nice day.
